Dozens arrested in pro-Palestinian protests at two major U.S. airportsPro-Palestinian protesters blocked morning traffic on Wednesday around Los Angeles International Airport and New York's John F. Kennedy International Airport - two of the nation's busiest - in coast-to-coast demonstrations that ended with dozens of arrests. Thu, 28 Dec 2023 00:29:07 GMT AYLS3373UFPTDDHJNASE2OW7WQ https://www.reuters.com/world/dozens-arrested-pro-palestinian-protests-two-major-us-airports-2023-12-28/Steve Gorman, Kanishka Singh世界
Russian stars' semi-naked party sparks wartime backlashA rapper who attended a celebrity party with only a sock to hide his modesty has been jailed for 15 days, sponsors of some of Russia's best known entertainers have torn up their contracts, and President Vladimir Putin is reported to be unamused. Thu, 28 Dec 2023 00:16:01 GMT B5XSF3J4KFLCLDFUUHT3EII4IA https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/ Russian-stars-semi-naked-party-sparks-wartime-backlash-2023-12-28/Andrew Osborn世界欧洲
Remittances from Nicaraguan migrants mark new record, passing $4 billionNicaraguan migrants sent relatives back home record remittances this year through November, data from the country's central bank showed on Wednesday, fueled by massive waves of migration leaving the Central American nation in recent years. Wed, 27 Dec 2023 23:38:27 GMT PHJFWWMCLZMUBALN4CTBOC57VI https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/remittances-nicaraguan-migrants-mark-new-record-passing-4-billion-2023-12-27/Reuters世界美洲
Mexico, US officials discuss urgency to reopen border crossings- Mexico ministerMexico's Foreign Minister Alicia Barce said on Wednesday she spoke with U.S. authorities about the importance of reopening border crossings, following the shutdown of some passages by the U.S. aimed at curbing rising migration. Israeli attacks in Gaza add to heavy Palestinian toll in war on HamasIsraeli forces pounded central Gaza by land, sea and air and Palestinian authorities reported dozens more deaths, with the U.N. health agency saying thousands of people were trying to flee the fighting. Moldova's president says Putin must be stoppedRussian President Vladimir Putin must be stopped in his war against Ukraine or all of Europe will pay a much higher price, Moldova's pro-European president, Maia Sandu, said in an interview published on Wednesday. US court rejects sentence appeal by Mexican drug lord 'El Chapo'A U.S. court has rejected an appeal by former Mexican drug lord Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzman to review a 2019 ruling that sentenced him to life in prison. Six Palestinians killed in Israeli raid in West Bank city of TulkarmSix Palestinians were killed by a drone strike during an Israeli raid n the West Bank city of Tulkarm, the Palestinian health ministry said on Wednesday, one of the latest examples of rising violence since the start of the Israel-Hamas war in Gaza. North Korea's Kim orders military to accelerate war preparations -state mediaNorth Korean leader Kim Jong Un has ordered its military, the munitions industry and the nuclear weapons sector to accelerate war preparations to counter what he called unprecedented confrontational moves by the U.S., state media said on Thursday. US to provide up to $250 mln in arms, equipment to Ukraine -BlinkenThe U.S. will provide up to $250 million in arms and equipment to Ukraine in the final package of aid this year to help Kyiv in its war with Russia, Secretary of State Antony Blinken said on Wednesday. Wed, 27 Dec 2023 20:57:35 GMT CLX275J35ZKQRLUWSEYKR4ACZY https://www.reuters.com/world/us-provide-up-250-mln-arms-equipment-ukraine-blinken-2023-12-27/Reuters世界
Sudan RSF leader visits Uganda in first known wartime foreign tripThe leader of Sudan’s paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF) General Mohamed Hamdan Dagalo said on Wednesday he met Uganda's President Yoweri Museveni, his first confirmed appearance outside of Sudan since the war between RSF and the Sudanese army broke out in April. Wed, 27 Dec 2023 20:48:29 GMT 5Q55DBIO7RJNNFAHQCVN3尊米https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/sudan-rsf-leader-visits-uganda-first-known-wartime-foreign-trip-2023-12-27/Reuters世界非洲
